(4) Nitric Oxide Scavenging Assay. Sodium nitroprusside (0.5 mL, 5 mmol/L, pH 7.4) was combined at different concentrations 0.1, 0.25, 0.5, and 1 mg/mL of test compounds, ascorbic acid, or an equivalent amount of methanol and incubated for 180 minutes (25°C). Griess reagent (1.5 mL) consisting of sulfanilamide (1%), phosphoric acid (2%), and N-1-naphthylethylenediamine dihydrochloride (0.1%) was added, and the mixture was again incubated for 30 minutes. Absorbance was measured at 546 nm, and the percentage of activity was determined relative to the standard [ 27]. The following equation was used to show percent inhibition:
(5)
% nitric oxide scavenging =
Absorbance of control – Absorbance of test
